protocol.title: High-Throughput Tiled Amplicon Sequencing of Sars-CoV2 using Seqwell's plexWell 384
protocol.title_html: High-Throughput Tiled Amplicon Sequencing of Sars-CoV2 using Seqwell's plexWell 384

source.description:
For cDNA synthesis of viral RNA, follow steps 1-6 of the v2 nCoV-2019 sequencing protocol by Josh Quick
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bdp7i5rn
.

source.body: A new version of this protocol has been released which replaces ThermoFisher's SSIV reverse transcriptase with NEB's Lunascript. Though this provides significant cost savings, in our limited trial, the SSIV RT significantly outperformed the Lunascript.
We did NOT dilute samples prior to cDNA conversion, and noticed no issues with PCR inhibition by not doing so. Samples were diluted prior to GS pcr. See below.

source.description:
GS amplification with ARTIC primers is based on version 2 of the nCoV-2019 protocol by Josh Quick (
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bdp7i5rn
) with modifications.
Using cDNA diluted in step 2, follow steps 6-9 of the ARTIC protocol above to complete gene-specific PCR. 35 cycles should be used for PCR

Because the plexWell protocol requires precise sample inputs, cDNA must be diluted prior to gene-specific PCR according to the following:
AB
1N2 CTDilution
212-151:1000
315-181:100
418-281:10
528+no dilution
Dilute in 10mM Tris HCl, 0.05% Tween 20, or 10mM Tris HCL.

AB
1N2 CTDilution
212-151:1000
315-181:100
418-281:10
528+no dilution
Perform one 1X and one 0.7X Ampure XP bead cleanups on the combined PCR product according to the following:

source.body: Because plexWell requires precise DNA input amounts, cleanups must be performed to ensure dimer removal for accurate quantitation. Do not simply dilute GS product as in the ARTIC protocol.

source.description: Following GS pcr, combine full volume of reaction 1 with full volume of reaction 2 (final volume, 50ul)

Following bead-cleanup, perform a Qubit spot-check of the concentrations of post-GS product across the plate. Typically, quantifying 15-20 samples of a 96-well plate is sufficent to calculate the global dilution factor for the subsequent step.
Alternatively, if high-throughput quantification methods are available (such as a fluorescent plate reader) quantify the entire plate using a fluorescent assay of choice (such as pico green).

Average DNA input of samples going into the plexWell protocol should be 2.5ng/ul.
If quantification at step 22 reveals the average concentration of samples is greater than 2.5ng/ul, perform the following plate-wide global dilution:
Global dilution factor = Average sample concentration/2.5ng
Perform dilution of all samples in plate by the above factor using 10mM Tris HCL. Avoid EDTA-containing solutions when diluting.

source.body:
The above is taken from Seqwell's protocol note on use of the plexWell 384 kit with Sars-CoV2 sequencing and the ARTIC protocol.
https://seqwell.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/20200526_plexWell_ARTIC_protocol_20200527.pdf
The DNA inputs for each plate going into the plexWell system must be very precise to ensure correct fragment sizes are obtained at the end of the protocol. Adding too much DNA to the initial tagmentation step can cause fragment sizes to be too large for efficient sequencing on certain short-read Illumina systems.

source.title: plexWell384 initial tagmentation and i7 addition

source.description:
Before beginning the plexWell protocol, bring the following reagents to room temperature:
ABC
1ReagentStorage conditionsFormat
2SBP/X96 Plate-20CPlate/Red
3MAGwise Paramagnetic Beads4CTube
4Pool Barcode Reagent-20CTube/Red
5Library Primer Mix-20CTube/Natural

ABC
1ReagentStorage conditionsFormat
2SBP/X96 Plate-20CPlate/Red
3MAGwise Paramagnetic Beads4CTube
4Pool Barcode Reagent-20CTube/Red
5Library Primer Mix-20CTube/Natural
Pour beads into reservoir for use with a 96 well plate.
For each reaction, pipette 50 uL beads into the reaction wells.
Mix by slowly pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Make sure solution is completely homogenous.
Let the mixture sit on the bench for 5 minutes for the beads to bind the DNA.
Place the plate on a magnetic plate and let it stand for 5 minutes for the beads to collect on the bottom of the plate.
Discard the liquid from wells without touching the beads.
Dispense 200µl 80% ethanol into each well without disturbing beads while the plate is sitting on a magnetic plate.
Incubate for 30 seconds. If you disturbed the beads, then let the mixture stand for 2 minutes.
Discard the ethanol without touching the beads.
Dispense another 200µl 80% ethanol into each well, without disturbing beads, while the plate is sitting on a magnetic plate.
Incubate for 30 seconds. If you disturbed the beads, then let the mixture stand for 2 minutes.
Discard the ethanol without touching the beads. Make sure all ethanol is discarded as it can interfere with DNA elution.
Place the plate on the bench and air dry beads for ~5 minutes or until beads appear dry (over-dried beads appear as a cracked, dried surface).
Pipette 32.5 uL of pre-warmed 10mM Tris HCL, 0.05% Tween 20 onto dry wells and pipette beads up and down to bring them into solution.
Place beads on a magnetic plate and let beads collect for 3 minutes.
Remove 30ul (leaving behind the 2.5uL extra volume) of eluted DNA into a new PCR reaction plate without touching the beads. The beads have no more DNA bound to them.

source.title: plexWell384 initial tagmentation and i7 addition

source.description:
Add 4ul of gene-specific product (diluted if necessary according to step 23 guidelines) to the appropriate wells of an SBP/X96 plate
Slowly pipette to mix. Try not to introduce excess bubbles.

source.body:
Steps 25-67 detail the protocol for Seqwell's plexWell 384 kit. The full user guide can be found here:
https://seqwell.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/plexWell_384_and_96_Library_Preparation_Kit_User_Guide.pdf
Protocol deviations from the above pdf will be noted in the steps below.

source.title: plexWell384 initial tagmentation and i7 addition

source.description:
Add 4ul of Coding Buffer into the wells of the SBP/X96 plate
Slowly pipette to mix. Try not to introduce excess bubbles. Seal plate and centrifuge at 1000XG for 1 minute.

source.body: At this point, depending on the model of thermal cycler being used, you may need to transfer the contents of the reaction to a mid-skirt plate.

source.description:
Centrifuge plate at 1000G for 1 minute to remove condensation from seal.
Dispense 6ul of solution X into each well of the plate.
Slowly pipette to mix. Try not to introduce excess bubbles. Seal plate and centrifuge at 1000XG for 1 minute.

source.title: plexWell384 initial tagmentation and i7 addition

source.description:
Centrifuge plate at 1000G for 1 minute to remove condensation from seal.
Combine 9ul of each reaction into a 2ml LoBind tube.
Vortex MAGwise Paramagnetic Beads thoroughly to ensure beads are resuspended in solution.
Add 850 uL (or ~approx. 1 volume equivalent) of MAGwise to the tube with the pooled SB reaction.
Pipette mix solution and incubate on benchtop for 5 minutes
Place tube on magnetic stand and wait for bead pellet to form (~3 minuntes)
Remove and discard supernatant. Do not disturb the pellet.
With the beads on the magnet, add two volumes of ethanol. (~1.7mL, or as much as is needed to cover the beads) Incubate for 30 seconds
Remove and discard supernatant

source.body: Complete this step quickly. Do not allow beads to dry out during wash process

source.description: Repeat steps 37-38 for a total of 2 washes
Cap the tube of beads, vortex, and spin briefly to bring residual ethanol to bottom of tube
Immediately place on magnet for beads to settle (~30 seconds)
Pipette out any residual ethanol
Add 40 uL of 10 mM Tris-HCl to bead pellet, remove from magnetic, pipette mix, and incubate on bench top for 5 min
Return tube to magnetic stand and wait for bead pellet to form (~2 minutes)
Carefully transfer out 39 uL of DNA eluate to a PCR tube [NOTE: This is your PRODUCT]
Quantify your pool with pico green or Qubit HS reagents.

source.body: Pool should quantify between 4-8ng/ul. If you are outside this range, dilute pool to achieve desired concentration. Correct concentration is essential to obtain products of appropriate size for sequencing.

source.description: Add 9ul PB reagent to PCR tube with the purified SB reaction pool. Take note of which pool barcode was used. Pipette thoroughly to mix.

source.body: The addition of 9ul PB reagent differs from the Seqwell protocol for the plexWell kit, and is necessary to achieve fragment sizes compatible with short-read sequencing.

This protocol is designed for the high-throughput sequencing of Sars-CoV-2 samples. For multiplexing purposes, ensure that a different pool barcode is used for each plate of 96 (up to 12 uniquely barcoded plates/pools total). Seqwell currently provides 1152 unique index combinations for this purpose.

source.description: Add 22ul Coding Buffer to the tube and pipette thoroughly to mix. Cap the tube, vortex, and centrifuge briefly.

Run the following program on a thermal cycler, with heated lid set to 100C
AB
1TemperatureTime
255C15min
325Chold

AB

325Chold

Briefly centrifuge tube. Add 33ul of X solution to the reaction. Pipette slowly to mix.
Re-cap tube and centrifuge briefly

Run the following program on a thermal cycler, with heated lid set to 100C
AB
1TemperatureTime
268C10 min

Vortex and spin PB reaction, and transfer contents to a 1.5ml LoBind tube
Vortex Magwsie beads thoroughly to ensure beads are resuspended in solution
Add 99ul MAGwise beads to the tube with the pooled SB reaction
Follow steps 33-41 to clean the SB reaction
Add 24ul of 10mM Tris-HCL to bead pellet, remove from magnetic stand, pipette to mix, and incubate on benchtop for 5 minutes
Return tube to magnetic stand and wait for bead pellet to form (~2 minutes)
Carefully transfer 23ul of DNA eluate to a new PCR tube.

source.body: The transfer of some beads with the purified product with not inhibit library amplification

source.description: Add 4ul of Library Primer Mix to the purified product

Add 27ul of Kapa HiFi Hotstart ReadyMix and mix well by pipetting.
Close PCR tube and centrifuge briefly.

Run the following program on a thermal cycler with heated lid set to 100C

1TemperatureTimeNotes
272C10 min
395C3 min
498C30 secRepeat steps 4-6 for 12 cycles total

Briefly centrifuge library amplification reaction and measure total volume using a pipette. Transfer product to LoBind tube.
Dilute the library to a final volume of 205ul with 10mM Tris-HCL pH 8.0 and pipette to mix
Transfer 100ul of diluted library to a new 1.5ml LoBind tube for clean-up. Store the remaining 105ul at -20C until QC is complete.

Vortex MAGwise beads thoroughly.
Add 75 ul (or ~.75 volumes) of MAGwise beads to the 100 ul of diluted amplified library

source.body: This volume differs from the Seqwell protocol for the plexWell kit, and is necessary to achieve fragment sizes compatible with short-read sequencing

source.description: Follow steps 33-41 to purify library amplification product
Add 32ul 10mM Tris-HCL to bead pellet, remove from magnet, pipette to mix, and incubate on bench top for 5 minutes
Return to magnetic stand and wait for bead pellet to form (~2 minutes)
Carefully transfer 28ul of DNA eluate to a new 1.5ml LoBind tube. This is the final purified library.
Visualize final library on a tapestation or bioanalyzer using high-sensitivity reagents.

source.name: Bioanalyzer chips and reagents (DNA High Sensitivity kit)

source.description:
Quantify final library using Kapa Quant reagents and an appropriate real-time PCR machine. Quantify multiple dilutions of each final library to ensure accurate readings.
Alternatively, qubit final library in triplicate to determine concentration.

source.name: KAPA Library Quantification Kit for Illumina® Platforms

source.description: Pool 12 (up to 1152 samples total) uniquely barcoded pools from steps 1-69 above at equimolar concentrations

Quantify final pool of pools using Kapa Quant reagents and an appropriate real-time PCR machine. Quantify multiple dilutions of each final library to ensure accurate readings.
Alternatively, qubit final library in triplicate to determine concentration.

source.name: KAPA Library Quantification Kit for Illumina® Platforms

source.description: Visualize final pool of pools on a bioanalyzer or fragment analyzer to determine final pool size. Pool may need to be diluted prior to running on HS kit. Alternatively, if expected concentration is high enough, DNA 1000 reagents may be used.

source.name: Bioanalyzer chips and reagents (DNA High Sensitivity kit)

source.description:
Sequence pool of pools (1152 samples total) on a NextSeq High-Output kit, using 150 X 150 bp paired end reads, and 8bp dual index reads. Added PhiX should be 5% of the total run.
Detailed loading instructions for Illumina NextSeq500/550 can be found here:
https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/documentation/system_documentation/nextseq/nextseq-denature-dilute-libraries-guide-15048776-09.pdf

source.body: We typically target a cluster density of 160-200k/mm2. This is slightly less than what Illumina recommends. We've found that having a higher Q30 but less overall data due to lower clustering is more desirable than having a lower Q30 but more overall data, particularly for amplicon sequencing. You can adjust this based on your own preferences.

We found that, for a pool of ~350bp in size, a loading concentration of 1.5 pM produced optimal results. Loading concentrations can vary slightly from machine to machine, however, and are dependent on overall library fragment size. You should adjust your loading concentration accordingly.

source.description: Repeat steps 5-22, using 35ul beads in step 7 for a second, 0.7X cleanup.
